page.title: 12LANGUAGE
page.content: IN{LUTHRIE}AND {MOONZIE }WE FOUND THAT ABOUT THREE QUARTERS OF THE POPULATION HAD A SCOTTISH ACCENT.THEY USED {SCOTTISH}EQUIVALENTS OF{ENGLISH}WORDS. A LOT OF PEOPLE IN{LUTHRIE}AND{MOONZIE USED THE WORDS{TATTIES}FOR{POTATOES, {BURN }FOR {STREAM, KIRK}FOR {CHURCH, {DOON }FOR {DOWN}AND{PEENY}FOR {APRON.} MORE THAN THREE QUARTERS OF THE POPULATION USED THESE WORDS.{RICHT FOR {RIGHT}AND{DINNAE }FOR{DON'T }WERE NOT USED AS MUCH AS THE OTHER WORDS.A LOT OF PEOPLE USED WORDS LIKE{TATTIEBOGLE {FOR SCARECROW.}HERE IS A SENTENCE WITH SOME OF OUR {SCOTTISH }WORDS IN IT: {THE SHILPIT FARM LAD WAS HOWKING {TATTIES DOON THE FIELD,WHERE A {TATTIEBOGLE STOOD,AHINT THE KIRK. THAT SENTENCE MEANS: {THE THIN AND DRAWN BOY WAS DIGGING UP {POTATOES IN THE FIELD WHERE A {SCARECROW STOOD BEHIND THE CHURCH. }
